search_results.snippet:
A chest tube is a flexible plastic tube that is inserted through the chest wall and 
into the pleural space or mediastinum. It is used to remove air (pneumothorax) or 
fluid (pleural effusion, blood, chyle), or pus (empyema) from the intrathoracic 
space. It is also known as a Blau drain or an intercostal catheter. ... Since a 
portion of the chest tube is inside the patient, 86% of the time chest...
